website_summaries.verdict: These double-layer gloves were specifically designed to provide an amazing level of warmth without limiting your dexterity.
pros: Ultra-warm, high-quality gloves with a removable, flexible liner
Synthetic leather is touchscreen compatible, and palms are grippy
Wrists can be cinched to go under boarding jacket
Toggle helps keep out the cold
Sizes XS to XL and choice of two colors
cons: Not all touchscreens respond to the synthetic leather material

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in this product. Got these as a gift in August for my birthday. Finally got to break them out for the first time today to shovel snow and when I got inside, noticed the palms were all ripped up. They’re super warm and cozy, but the leather on the palms must break down really easily. This was the first time I’d worn them. Maybe I just got a defective pair? I’ve always known Burton to make awesome winter gear. I’m so sad :(
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Luv em!
customer_reviews.text: I live in WI and the winters are brutal. Temps reaching well below zero and I've been searching for gloves that will keep my hands warm. Most of the pairs of gloves I bought previously just didn't do the job and got damp from my hands sweating, and my fingers stayed cold. These gloves are well made! They fit just right, and no more cold hands. Ladies, if you are debating about getting these gloves, my reply to that.....spend the money, you'll be glad you did! Well worth every single penny!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Austin

customer_reviews.title: These work better for me in cold temps than Burton gloves.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of sub-zero Burton gloves, but my fingers still froze when shoveling snow in below freezing temps after only a few minutes. Hand warmers were ineffective, as they’d only warm the palm or back of my hand. I decided mittens were the way to go. I returned the gloves and purchased these mittens, which I use with liners and hand warmers, and though temps haven’t been as low since I’ve gotten the mittens, they feel a whole lot warmer. I like the look, feel and fit of the mittens, and would recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Walker

customer_reviews.title: Midwinter Glove - Looks Good!
customer_reviews.text: I got XS in Port Royal Heather, got them at about $35 and everything was there. They fit perfect and to me, the shell is a bit bulky material but that is expected. The shell is touchscreen capable BUT the liners are not (are they usually not?). This was maybe the first time I have gotten Burton with Gore-Tex and I’m excited to try them out this winter. I read the label on them, they are meant for mid-winter conditions but I’m not too concerned. I saw reviews saying they were fine in places like Chicago (that place is cold!) - I should be using them mostly for snowboarding.
customer_reviews.author: Roz

customer_reviews.title: Kept hands warm in Iceland
customer_reviews.text: These were amazing for a winter trip to Iceland. Sometimes it was difficult to hold my phone or camera and take photos, but the gloves did work with the touchscreen on my Samsung Galaxy S8+. The gloves shielded my hands from the cold and wind, and even warmed my hands up after not wearing the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as I needed a high quality pair of gloves for a trip to Antarctica. These gloves were fantastic. They kept my hands warm and dry. The liner of comes with is not touch screen compatible but I just used another pair of touchscreen gloves (Isotoner). The gloves have a spot to insert a hand warmer packet, but I never needed them. I had gone to REI and tried on tons of pairs of gloves and bought these and I'm glad I did. Great purchase, great product. I know these will last me a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box you can tell that these gloves are very high quality. They have great little details, small storage space for credit cards or keys, and seem like they are going to keep my hands very warm. I’m constantly taking my gloves on and off while I’m on the slopes, so having that inner liner is a big plus to be able to use my phone and whatnot, while still having my hands protected from the cold. Like them a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah N. Osorio

customer_reviews.title: Last year's model (W19) is great at half the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent feel without being ridiculously bulky with both lining and outer gloves worn at the same time. Warm with a couple extra clips to fasten onto your coat, each other, whatever. I dig the hand warmer zip pockets, although I'll probably only use them for cash or small easy-to-use items. Burton brand always delivers a quality pair. I got the W19 (as opposed to the 20's) for half the price and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Cori & Company

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found - 2 ski trips down
customer_reviews.text: I've been on the hunt for ski gloves that don't get too wet or at least dry out fast. So far these are the best. Not perfect but getting there. I love the inner glove that you can take out. First, you can take off the bulky glove to zip up or fix a binding without having a naked hand. Second, when you drying them it helps dry faster to remove that layer. i believe they are water proof but you collect moisture on the inside from your hand sweat.
customer_reviews.author: engineer-er

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME For Skiing! Zipper pocket very useful!
customer_reviews.text: As a new skier I was advised to be sure to get GOOD gloves! These were on the pricer end of my budget but I decided to go for it because the reviews were so good. This is my second season using them and the gloves have held up well. *BONUS POINTS* Your IKON pass (or ID/credit card) will fit in the zipped pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Fayelle

customer_reviews.title: 100% satisfied with these winter gloves. they are the bomb!!
customer_reviews.text: The glove liner could be a little longer so it can go to your rest. And the long stretchy string have no idea why thats on there. I took mine off it was a pain. The gloves are wonderful my hands have the worst time getting warm. With these i feel like i can do my job outside. which im a Crossing Guard, and i make sure to put layers on and where the best brands for winter weather. Im all ways shovelling my drive way and side walk and when it gets to - 0°F or - 11°F . I don't have to worry about freezing my hands off they stay nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: S. K.

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my lady, and she really likes them. She was skiing in some 0F weather for several hours in them before her hands would get cold. Really good gloves, will update if the durability isn't there, but based on my experience with burton, they'll hold up. I still have a pair of 15 year old burton gloves, though the snot wipe is shot, they're still solid and waterproof. I have faith these will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: EN Wags

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: They may seem like an expensive pair of gloves but definitely are worth it. It comes with two sets of gloves. One set is a thinner pair that is touch screen and you put the thicker ones over them. So when you’re outside and need to answer a call you don’t have to take your hands out of warmth fully. The quality is the best part about these gloves and I’ve owned other pairs as well.
customer_reviews.author: Yelena

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are incredibly comfortable. They aren't necessarily as warm as one would ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are incredibly comfortable. They aren't necessarily as warm as one would expect since they are rated as Burton's warmest gloves, but they are at least waterproof so that helps. These do run small. I don't have huge hands (I'm 5'7") but I still needed a large, which I knew because I tried them on in a store first. Probably not worth paying full price, but the comfortability is definitely nice.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Hilow

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands and usually have to buy kid's gloves, but the xtra small gloves fit me perfectly! I haven't tried the water-proofness of the gloves yet, but I will update after I go snowboarding. One thing to note (that I missed while reading the description) is that the liner doesn't have capacitive touchscreen capabilities unfortunately. Otherwise, these gloves are really soft and comfortable to wear and the tightening strap around the wrist is easy to loosen/tighten. Will update more later.
customer_reviews.author: bittenapples

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves, but a bit bulky
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my wife to use during the cold Michigan winters. They’re nice and keep her hands warm, but they’re so thick she has trouble using her hands in them. They’re great for playing outside with the kids, but not for driving due to the lack of feel. The secondary liner is nice, but not warm enough for her liking so she doesn’t use the lining separately.
customer_reviews.author: Rico Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Stylish
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because I was hoping the inner glove would have the sticky feature I've seen come with this exact glove at the store.. sticky to help you hold your phone better. Anywho these are going with me to Iceland so I hope they keep my hands warm!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lenz

customer_reviews.title: IT'S TRUE!
customer_reviews.text: OMG...a thick winter glove I don't have to remove in cold weather to use my phone! Works as advertised and felt toasty warm as soon as I put them on! Having the hot hands pocket is also a must! I'll update more later after I've had a chance to break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer G.

customer_reviews.title: Liners not touchscreen compatible
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves for a 2-week long, winter trip to Norway. They were comfortable and kept my hands extremely warm, even during heavy snow in the Arctic Circle. The liners are great for cool weather but do not work with a touchscreen meaning I had to take off my glove every time I wanted to take a picture. The outer gloves are touch screen compatible but are quite bulky and are hard to actually use in a functional manner with a touchscreen but who cares when you hands are warm!
customer_reviews.author: Blaire Verzi

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 10 yr old daughter for skiing. They were good in high 20s low 30s. She likes to use hand warmers along with them. They fit well. Got a small for 10yr old thats 5 foot. Nice features
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size small (I am a small in gloves). They fit me perfect. The packing was great-- fast shipping. Gloves did not look like they had been worn or tried on by other people. The gloves came with an extra pair of "lining" gloves. I wore them during my trip to Tahoe (when there was blizzard going on)-- my hands were warm in a 12°F weather, super water proof. I would recommend to anyone (gloves about $10 cheaper than your local sports store).
customer_reviews.author: Brenda A.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your hands warm
customer_reviews.text: I love Burton gloves and have had my first pair of Burton gloves for at least 15 years. I only replaced them because they were starting to rip at the seams. The newer version is very similar to my first pair with a couple of upgrades like the warming pocket and it definitely keeps your hands warm.
customer_reviews.author: J. L.

customer_reviews.title: these gloves were great. I bought them to replace an old pair ...
customer_reviews.text: For a reasonable price, these gloves were great. I bought them to replace an old pair for snowboarding and they withstood the negative temperatures! The extra insert gloves that come with them are awesome too. I use them with the gloves and on their own when I snowboard or go on runs around the neighborhood. I would highly recommend these for any temperature!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My daughter wanted these specifically so I had to buy them
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted these specifically so I had to buy them but come on....the price is ridiculous. Theres nothing special about these that can justify the price. If you can get away with buying gloves for someone who isnt brand name driven than dont buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves! I wore them skiing this weekend in about 15 degree weather. I normally get very cold fingers and toes, and do not last long in the cold. I skied for 4 hours and my fingers were never cold. I wore both the liner and glove. Would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: toniket23

customer_reviews.title: STOKED on these-HIGHLY Recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: Avid recreational skier but can only afford a little. Splurged on these and I'm SO GLAD I did; they fit perfect. The inner gloves are super nice. The hidden compartment for hand warmer works perfectly. They are durable, warm and versatile. The also look great. I'm sure they will last!
customer_reviews.author: Josh and Holly

customer_reviews.title: Fit is off and liner is not touch screen friendly
customer_reviews.text: These are my first heavy snow gloves. I bought a medium based on the size chart (middle finger = 3 inches). The inner glove I received does not match the one of the black pair. I somehow received the pair the "Sedona" color. The middle finger of the liner does fit, but the thumb is too wide and loose for me. The liner is not touch screen friendly, so they're not great standalone gloves. The fingers on the outer gloves look short. I haven't really been able to wear them out yet but will update when I do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and So Cold!
customer_reviews.text: These are bulky and hard to squeeze my fingers to hold my ski pole. I want to like them but they do not keep my fingers warm at all. My fingers cramp and hurt. For $65, I feel ripped off especially since I can't return them now. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Great for snowboarding
customer_reviews.text: I got these gloves for snowboarding this season, they’ve kept my hands dry and warm through rain and snow! Very comfortable to wear in ~15F temperature, and worked great on touch screen!
customer_reviews.author: Guangtao Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Keep your hands toasty and snowy weather!
customer_reviews.text: Love these Burton gloves! The color is so pretty. They are easy to put on even when your hands are cold. The touch screen was a little tricky at times because there was a little bit of extra room in the pointer finger. I got used to it and learned quickly to go slow which seem to help. The inner gloves help to keep your hands extra warm!
customer_reviews.author: Nettebunny

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought these gloves , I experienced a cold day when my finger froze. Then with these gloves my hands were warm. And I was able to take my hand out of the outer glove and keep the inner glove on as needed. My hands never got cold. Toggle is good too - it keeps out the cold.
customer_reviews.author: mommy

customer_reviews.title: good quality gloves
customer_reviews.text: I used these while learning to snowboard. With that being said, they got wet, a lot. They have held up and also kept my hands warm. I'm able to fit glove liners inside without them being too loose or too tight. I think these gloves are a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: jesse brady

customer_reviews.title: Warm, stylish
customer_reviews.text: For perfect much warmer than my other Burton gloves. Spent 5 hrs on the mountain my hands were warm. Wish the inner layer was screen friendly. Love the pocket perfect for my lift pass.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny O

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the idea of spending this much money on gloves but I'm glad I did. My hands get very cold easily but these keep them dry and warm! Even while outside playing in the snow with my daughter. They are very bulky. Not good for any fine motor skills. But I use them to clear off my car, shovel, and play in the snow. Haven't tried using my phone while wearing them so can't attest to that. I bought them a year ago and they have held up well. I'm a small framed person with small hands - XS fit me well.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love those. They are super warm and the pockets are very convenient. The under gloves are also really nice and warm. Touch screen is not that easy to use due to size of the finger. But taking my phone out of my pocket is such a big pain that I don’t even try. That said it works if I really need to. And I don’t particularly care that much about the touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Ana C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a Christmas present. She says these keep her fingers nice a toasty.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN E HARRIS

customer_reviews.title: Used these in Antarctica- these come with 2 layers of ...
customer_reviews.text: Used these in Antarctica- these come with 2 layers of gloves- one is a set of thinner gloves you wear underneath the bulkier, more insulated layer. The first layer was enough to keep my hands warm and dry on zodiacs but the outer layer still allowed enough mobility if it was cold enough to need them.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Powell

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: They are very warm and comfortable. My wife ordered XS and the gloves fir her good but the liners are tighter. At least the gloves are warm already and she won't need the liners.
customer_reviews.author: Chris&Tukky

customer_reviews.title: Your hands will still get cold
customer_reviews.text: I don’t find these gloves keep my hands as warm as I hoped. They are a little tight as well. I do like that they have an inner lining glove that can be worn separately.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate snow sport glove
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gloves for snowboarding. After going though cheap gloves these are durable and will last. The added features such as the removable liners, heat warmer pockets, wrist loops and easy tightening and loosing tabs make it the perfect winter sport glove. I highly recommend these gloves as they keep your hands warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: N.M.

customer_reviews.title: We will buy again
customer_reviews.text: We love these and they were way better than the $80 gloves we bought at the store. They have zippers on the top of the glove to hold a ski pass or cards and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Short fingers
customer_reviews.text: Very short fingers. Hard to size, none of the sizes fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kaize

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: By far the best gloves I’ve ever owned definitely keep your hands warm and cozy
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Burton at a discounted price
customer_reviews.text: Only giving 4 stars because I thought that the fit ran a little on the small side. Otherwise, these were great! I like that there is a lighter inside layer - I needed both layers early in the morning but as the day went on and it got hotter (and I fell down less), I switched to just the inside layer.
customer_reviews.author: Ysobel Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Wear these to ride a Moped. Keeps my fingers warm and I feel no wind. A little bulky to do the throttle and brake but I'm very happy with them
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: well-made, sturdy material
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the small, figured they would work perfectly. Should've gone with the extra small. Maybe the fit is the reason they aren't quite as warm as I had hoped. Nice gloves, though.
customer_reviews.author: WilliesMom

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands so felt bulky BUT the extra inner gloves helped. You have to take off when doing camera but there definitely were some cold snowy days that kept hands dry!
customer_reviews.author: mestucson

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Amazing gloves for skiing and snowboarding. Bought them for the entire family. Worth every dollar!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle King

customer_reviews.title: An investment well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love Gore-Tex Gloves. These are a replacement for the same kind but different design. Winter hasn't been cold enough to warrant wearing them this year, but they are cute and I know they'll keep me warm when I need them. Also, can't beat the little zipper for bus passes and dollar bills.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. This is not a durable product
customer_reviews.text: They fit well and I was very excited to wear them outside. I wore them once to go sledding and got a small hole in the top layer of the fabric on one of the fingers. Very disappointed. This is not a durable product. My last Burton gloves lasted for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and do their job
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof and warm. These weren't able to keep my fingers warm though even with the liners, but I'm beginning to think that's just how my hands are.. Cold, but it wasn't as bad as usual. Gloves fit perfect and work great! Plus the material seems pretty heavy duty so they should last. The liners don't work with a touch-screen though
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry. Good gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the medium (womens)...and while they fit probably perfectly but I prefer a tad more room in my gloves so maybe I should have purchased the large? I don't have large hands though..so that's why I went with a medium. Usually I've ordered a Men's Small in the past..but all of those are too large on me now. Anyway....these keep you super room and dry. They're great gloves.
customer_reviews.author: EAH

customer_reviews.title: Warm gloves
customer_reviews.text: East coast skiing my daughters hands always cold great glove no more complaints of numb fingers means she enjoys skiing more means more skiing for Dad well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M.

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves and liners lived up to expectation
customer_reviews.text: These are great, warm, versatile gloves. My first time using them was on a long weekend skiing in Mammoth and they passed the test. The only trivial thing I would say is that getting the wrists tucked under your coat sleeve for a snug snow/cold proofing was tricky because some of the ties on the gloves are so long.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not very warm
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves but they're not that warm. Even with the liner.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. E

customer_reviews.title: this glove system kept my wife's normally freezing hands comfortably warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: The first gloves since moving to the northeast that keep my wife's hands warm. They come with liners and insulated outer shell. Either can be worn alone or together. Worn in the snow in single digit (Fahrenheit) temperatures, this glove system kept my wife's normally freezing hands comfortably warm and dry. We strongly recommend these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: One Man

customer_reviews.title: This gloves are excellent for skying
customer_reviews.text: This gloves are excellent for skying, they will keep your hands warm and they’re not stiff as other sky gloves I’ve had before. I’m so sad I lost one of them as I accidentally drop it from thr lift. The liner was so good it kept my hand warm as I sky down the mountain with just one glove on.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Too big and not enough warmth
customer_reviews.text: They are very bulky, my hands could not move much and were still cold.
customer_reviews.author: klm

customer_reviews.title: Warm

customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Inner Glove is Great
customer_reviews.text: The inner lying is the best part of this purchase. The out glove is very bulky and limits your movement to grabbing and holding objects.
customer_reviews.author: OP

customer_reviews.title: Good and comfortable for hitting the slopes
customer_reviews.text: Good and comfortable for hitting the slopes! I like the compartment for the heating pads or some small thing to carry and the base gloves with fingertip that can work on phone screens.

customer_reviews.text: Good quality construction. Fingers are a little short. Suitable for medium cold environments only.

customer_reviews.title: I like this gloves
customer_reviews.text: I like this gloves , but if you have small hands, it's better if you choose another kind more fitted, but the quality is very good and they keep my hands pretty warm.

customer_reviews.author: Julia Dooley Fairchild

customer_reviews.text: The inner lining glove helped and it fit perfectly. It's a little large if you don't use the lining gloves. Thank you for refunding my return on my mistake for ordering an extra pair of gloves and a stomp pad that I wasn't too fond of. Great service! Would buy again!

customer_reviews.text: Best gloves ever! I would love more of these but i feel like it is going to take me awhile to get a new pair cuz they seem really sturdy and well made.

customer_reviews.text: I use these for snowboarding and they are great. They keep my hands very dry, although sometimes my hands do get cold.

customer_reviews.title: Kept my hands warm all day
customer_reviews.text: I loves these gloves so much! They kept my hands warm on the mountain and fit true to size (Medium). I really liked that Burton gives you 2 pairs of gloves for the price of one. The lighter/fleece gloves give you great mobility when putting your snowboard on which is nice. I do like that there is a little zip pocket on the outside of the glove to fit cash or a hand warmer in them. These gloves are worth the money.

product_meta.title: Burton Womens Gore Glove
product_meta.description: The life of a glove is not easy. More than any other part of your riding kit, gloves have the most contact with the elements. With that in mind, the Burton team chooses the women's bestselling Burton GORE-TEX Glove + Gore warm technology. DRYRIDE 2L fabric, and a GUARANTEED TO KEEP YOU DRY GORE-TEX membrane protect this Thermacore insulated glove from the worst weather conditions. Screen Grab synthetic leather gives you stealth touchscreen control with any finger. A removable four-way stretch fleece liner dries quickly and gives you options for any weather. Wear just the liner when shoveling, just the shell in sloppy spring conditions, or combine the two for total midwinter warmth and comfort.
